result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashley Marie Lewis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Concurrent to current sentence.
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

superMiscConds.notes: It is hereby ordered, as a condition of probation in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Wal-Mart.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.

Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Kenneth N. Sortedahl, DF ATTY: Shirlene Renee Perrin   DF:  Ashley Marie Lewis appeared from jail.  Court recalled at 3:03 p.m.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 1. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:  

-  Initial Confinement 1.5 years with 2 years E/S with conditions
-  Sentence Concurrent to current sentence
 - It is hereby ordered that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Wal Mart.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  
- 20 days to appeal

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Kenneth N. Sortedahl, DF ATTY: Shirlene Renee Perrin   DF: Ashley Marie Lewis appeared from jail.  Court called at 3:02 p.m.  DE is waiving her right to a preliminary hearing.  DE files with the court the Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver. Court finds that DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives right to a preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DE probably committed one and binds the DE over for trial.  Court adjourned at 3:03 p.m.
